title: Breast Ultrasound
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: What Is a Breast Ultrasound?
content: A breast ultrasound is a painless procedure that uses sound waves to make images of the inside of your breast. The sound waves bounce off surfaces in your body, and the "echoes" are recorded to make video or photographs.

content_blocks.text: A breast ultrasound is a painless procedure that uses sound waves to make images of the inside of your breast. The sound waves bounce off surfaces in your body, and the "echoes" are recorded to make video or photographs.

sections.heading: Breast Ultrasound Purpose
content: You might get a breast ultrasound:
bullets: If your breast tissue is too dense for a mammogram
If you’re pregnant
If you’re younger than 25
To look more closely at a suspicious area spotted on a mammogram
To see if breast implants have broken open (ruptured)
To tell whether a lump in your breast is a cyst (a fluid-filled sac) or a solid mass, which might be cancer
To pinpoint the position of a tumor. This guides the doctor to the exact place to put in a needle during a biopsy .

content_blocks.text: You might get a breast ultrasound:
associated_bullets: If your breast tissue is too dense for a mammogram
If you’re pregnant
If you’re younger than 25
To look more closely at a suspicious area spotted on a mammogram
To see if breast implants have broken open (ruptured)
To tell whether a lump in your breast is a cyst (a fluid-filled sac) or a solid mass, which might be cancer
To pinpoint the position of a tumor. This guides the doctor to the exact place to put in a needle during a biopsy .

sections.heading: Breast Ultrasound Preparation
content: Your doctor will explain the procedure and answer any questions you might have. You may need to sign a form that says you consent to the ultrasound.

content_blocks.text: Your doctor will explain the procedure and answer any questions you might have. You may need to sign a form that says you consent to the ultrasound.

content: You can eat and drink as usual before the test. But don’t put any lotions or powders on your breasts.
Wear clothing that you can take off easily. You’ll undress from the waist up and wear a gown during the procedure.

content_blocks.text: You can eat and drink as usual before the test. But don’t put any lotions or powders on your breasts.
Wear clothing that you can take off easily. You’ll undress from the waist up and wear a gown during the procedure.

sections.heading: Breast Ultrasound Procedure
content: The exact test may depend on your case, but in general:
bullets: You’ll lie back on a padded examining table.
The technician will put a small amount of water-soluble gel on the skin over the area to be examined. The gel doesn’t harm your skin or stain your clothes.
They’ll gently move a probe that looks like a little paddle over the skin.
They may ask you to hold your breath briefly several times.
The test takes about 10 to 20 minutes to complete.
The technician then wipes the gel off your skin. You can get dressed and go back to your regular schedule.

content_blocks.text: The exact test may depend on your case, but in general:
associated_bullets: You’ll lie back on a padded examining table.
The technician will put a small amount of water-soluble gel on the skin over the area to be examined. The gel doesn’t harm your skin or stain your clothes.
They’ll gently move a probe that looks like a little paddle over the skin.
They may ask you to hold your breath briefly several times.
The test takes about 10 to 20 minutes to complete.
The technician then wipes the gel off your skin. You can get dressed and go back to your regular schedule.

sections.heading: Breast Ultrasound Results
content: A specialist called a radiologist will look at the images and send a report to your doctor.
Your doctor will talk with you about your results and whether you need follow-up exams. You may need them:
bullets: If your doctor thinks a problem spot needs a closer look or a different imaging test
To watch for changes over time
To check whether a certain treatment is working

content_blocks.text: A specialist called a radiologist will look at the images and send a report to your doctor.
Your doctor will talk with you about your results and whether you need follow-up exams. You may need them:
associated_bullets: If your doctor thinks a problem spot needs a closer look or a different imaging test
To watch for changes over time
To check whether a certain treatment is working

sections.heading: Breast Ultrasound Risks and Side Effects
content: Ultrasound is safe. There are no side effects. It doesn’t use radiation like X-rays do.

content_blocks.text: Ultrasound is safe. There are no side effects. It doesn’t use radiation like X-rays do.

meta_description: A breast ultrasound is a painless procedure that uses sound waves to make images of the inside of your breast. Learn more about the breast ultrasound procedure, risks, purpose, results, and preparation.
